derivation.yuyuan_name: early 16th cent. (designating a calf-length boot): probably from Old French bouzequin, variant of brousequin, from Middle Dutch broseken, of unknown ultimate origin

means.word_mean: 1. a boot reaching halfway up to the knee

auth_sentence.content: He was a critic upon operas, too, And knew all niceties of the sock and buskin.
